Tariffs: EU hands Trump a political win to avoid trade chaos
subhead: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump reached an agreement imposing a 15% tariff on most European products imported to the US. The 27 EU member states also committed to purchasing more American oil and gas, and to investing in the country.

Trump shortens 50-day deadline for Russia to end war in Ukraine
subhead: Donald Trump said he would now give Vladimir Putin 10 to 12 days from Monday, meaning he wants peace efforts to make progress by August 7-9. The plan includes possible sanctions and secondary tariffs targeting Russia's trading partners.

title: Israel slightly eases its grip on Gaza
subhead: Israel announced a suspension of its operations during daytime hours in three areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the Israeli military, 120 trucks carrying aid entered the territory on Sunday – a figure far below the 600 vehicles that entered daily before the war.

title: K-pop boy band Stray Kids light up Paris with well-oiled show and adoring fans
subhead: The South Korean group performed two concerts at the Stade de France on July 26 and 27, for the French leg of their Dominate World Tour.

title: Initial tariff impacts painful for auto, textile and chemical industries
subhead: Six months after Donald Trump introduced the first US tariffs, companies have started to feel the effects of a shock whose repercussions, though they have been contained for now, are likely to be long-lasting.

Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
subhead: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

title: Léon Marchand rides post-Olympic wave into World Championships in Singapore
subhead: Since winning four gold medals at the Olympics last year, the French swimmer has been learning to live with his newfound fame. Before the World Championships began, he took a trip to Australia to train and relax.

title: France's Gergovie plateau continues to reveal its ancient secrets
subhead: After four years exploring the depths of this archeological site in central France, archeologists have begun to draw their first conclusions, particularly regarding the so-called 'craftsmen's quarter.' This is the fourth excavation campaign at Gergovie since 1861, a site that once hosted the capital of the Arverni people.
